body: Does it happen in debug mode? Also would you mind to `cargo build --release` and then launch `lldb target/release/alacritty` and posting instruction where it fails and a backtrance.
~~Just to clarify, this probably happened with the packaged Alacritty release, right? I think compiling from source might just fix this.~~
@chrisduerr it's not, you can see the command `cargo run --release` in the provided output.
Oh, guess I need some new glasses, please disregard. Thanks @kchibisov.
There are some previous issues with similar problems on the latest nightly compiler. So changing from nightly to stable (or the other way around) might help.

issue.title: Illegal instruction on macOS with startup_mode Maximized and no decorations
issue.body:
Since `729eef0` I started getting `Illegal instruction: 4` with this configuration:
```yaml
window:
  decorations: none
  startup_mode: Maximized
```

When changing `decorations` to `buttonless`, it works. Also, if changing `startup_mode` to `Windowed`, it works fine.

OS: macOS Mojave v10.14.6

body:
@chrisduerr I tried the latest nightly, didn't help. I also tried in debug, didn't change anything.

@kchibisov I tried running with lldb and this is the output:

```
Process 2188 launched: '/Users/wgahr/Code/rust/alacritty/target/release/alacritty' (x86_64)
Process 2188 stopped
* thread #1, queue = 'com.apple.main-thread', stop reason = EXC_BAD_INSTRUCTION (code=EXC_I386_INVOP, subcode=0x0)
    frame #0: 0x00007fff6b4d282f libdispatch.dylib`__DISPATCH_WAIT_FOR_QUEUE__ + 387
libdispatch.dylib`__DISPATCH_WAIT_FOR_QUEUE__:
->  0x7fff6b4d282f <+387>: ud2

libdispatch.dylib`_dispatch_sync_complete_recurse:
    0x7fff6b4d2831 <+0>:   pushq  %rbp
    0x7fff6b4d2832 <+1>:   movq   %rsp, %rbp
    0x7fff6b4d2835 <+4>:   pushq  %r14
Target 3: (alacritty) stopped.
```
This is odd. Is your bug similar to #2905 (startup options, etc)? Also would you mind to test `v0.3.3`?
@voider1 so, its working, right? So I assume this commit broke it for you 729eef0c933831bccfeac6a355bdb410787fbe5f.
Also, I still need a backtrace output from `lldb`, to get one you should type `bt all` on crash.

Here's the output:

```(lldb) bt all
* thread #1, queue = 'com.apple.main-thread', stop reason = EXC_BAD_INSTRUCTION (code=EXC_I386_INVOP, subcode=0x0)
  * frame #0: 0x00007fff6b4d282f libdispatch.dylib`__DISPATCH_WAIT_FOR_QUEUE__ + 387

    frame #3: 0x0000000100256007 alacritty`winit::platform_impl::platform::window::UnownedWindow::is_zoomed::hd2a960a65d56692c [inlined] winit::platform_impl::platform::window::UnownedWindow::set_style_mask_sync::h54e7dc8976e066e5 at window.rs:398 [opt]

    frame #8: 0x00000001000180af alacritty`alacritty::window::create_gl_window::ha227ddbe7b3b4bce [inlined] winit::window::WindowBuilder::build::hf99152b202bd7a25 at window.rs:311 [opt]

    frame #12: 0x00000001000f1783 alacritty`alacritty::display::Display::new::h3454b777d94b73d3 [inlined] alacritty::window::Window::new::he9eddeb7372a060e at window.rs:153:12 [opt]

@voider1 Could you repro with default config? Just run `alacritty --config-file /dev/null`? If you can't repro with it would you mind sharing your config `window` section?

~Also could you test #2910?~

Just retest latest master, since PR Ive mentioned was merged.
I retested with the latest master, using `--config-file /dev/null` and that does the trick. Weird thing is, on my other Mac (running the same version) my config works.
